channel.title: Is it possible to have Nested VirtualBox with Windows 10?
channel.description:
So it seems that a nested virtual box inside Whonix can be created with Windows 7. However when I try to load the 32 bit Windows 10 I get the following error from VirtualBox: > vt-x/amd-v hardware acceleration is not available on your system. certain guests (e.g. os/2 and qnx) require this feature and will fail to boot without it.
I have learnt this error occurs becuase all Windows versions from Windows 8/8.1 onwards require hardware virtualisation.
Is there a way to fix this issue and install Windows 10?

item.title: Is it possible to have Nested VirtualBox with Windows 10?
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

The first and most important question would be, whether or not your CPU does indeed support hardware virtualization.

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible to have Nested VirtualBox with Windows 10?

item.title: Is it possible to have Nested VirtualBox with Windows 10?
item.dc:creator: maxcollen
item.description:
So it seems that a nested virtual box inside Whonix can be created with Windows 7. However when I try to load the 32 bit Windows 10 I get the following error from VirtualBox:

vt-x/amd-v hardware acceleration is not available on your system. certain guests (e.g. os/2 and qnx) require this feature and will fail to boot without it.

I have learnt this error occurs becuase all Windows versions from Windows 8/8.1 onwards require hardware virtualisation.

Is there a way to fix this issue and install Windows 10?
